security: Disclosing whether Peter J. DiGervino has been voluntarily declared or involuntarily exposed to foreign governments/intelligence services could compromise ongoing or future operations involving him. Quoting directly: "...this staff would appreciate being advised whether or not the subject has been voluntarily declared to foreign governments and intelligence/security services or involuntarily exposed to them."
summary: A memorandum from Thomas K. Strange to Marvin Wehking requesting information on Peter J. DiGervino's potential exposure to foreign intelligence services before establishing non-official cover for him in Madrid, Spain.
summary_one_paragraph: On June 12, 1967, Thomas K. Strange, Chief of CCS/NC, sent a secret memorandum to Marvin Wehking, Deputy Director of Security Investigation and Operational Support, regarding Peter J. DiGervino. The memo requests confirmation by June 19, 1967, as to whether DiGervino has been voluntarily declared or involuntarily exposed to foreign governments and intelligence/security services. This information is required to assess security factors before establishing non-official cover for DiGervino for an assignment in Madrid, Spain.
title: Peter J. DiGervino (p)
recipient: Deputy Director of Security Investigation and Operational Support (Marvin Wehking)
